text: Microhyla chakrapanii is a species of narrow-mouthed frog only known from the type locality, Mayabunder, in the Andaman Islands. Little is known about this rare species: it is presumed to be a fossorial or terrestrial species, possibly associated with leaf-litter substrate; it presumably breeds in water by larval development. ==References== chakrapanii Category:Frogs of India Category:Fauna of the Andaman and Nicobar Islands Category:Endemic fauna of India Category:Amphibians described in 1977
title: Microhyla chakrapanii
